title.value: The Evidence Mismatch in Pediatric Surgical Practice
title.justification: The title 'The Evidence Mismatch in Pediatric Surgical Practice' is explicitly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: The Evidence Mismatch in Pediatric Surgical Practice

extractions.description: This research paper investigates the mismatch between evidence-based management recommendations and actual practice patterns for four common outpatient pediatric surgical conditions: dermoid cyst, epigastric hernia, hydrocele, and umbilical hernia. Through a rapid review of existing literature, it evaluates the evidence volume and discrepancies in clinical practice, highlighting the reliance on weak or outdated studies and common wisdom rather than genuine evidence.

type.justification: The paper conducts a rapid review of existing literature and analyzes published cohort studies and management recommendations, indicating an empirical approach.
type.quote: Methods: Using the Cochrane Rapid Review Group recommendations and librarian oversight, we conducted a rapid review of 4 outpatient surgical conditions...

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on medical research related to pediatric surgical conditions and evidence-based clinical practices.
name.quote: We explore existing evidence-based management recommendations and the mismatch with practice patterns for four common outpatient pediatric surgical conditions.

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses outpatient pediatric surgical conditions such as dermoid cysts, epigastric hernias, hydroceles, and umbilical hernias.
name.quote: Purpose: Outpatient pediatric surgical practice often involves conditions of limited morbidity but significant parental concern.

name.justification: The paper evaluates existing evidence-based management recommendations and their mismatch with actual practice, a key aspect of evidence-based medicine.
name.quote: The mismatch with practice patterns highlights the reliance on weak or outdated studies... rather than genuine evidence.
